intro: Helosciadium crassipes, commonly known as the broad-leaved helosciadium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a pinnate structure and small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
